transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Hi Zhi, this is Arjun from MongoDB—do you have a quick minute to chat about your recent migration plans at Acme Corp.?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Hey Arjun, I’ve got a few minutes. What’s up?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Great, thank you! So, I saw Acme Corp. is moving infrastructure—are you considering modernizing your database layer as well, or sticking to your current on-prem MongoDB setup?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, we’re evaluating options. Honestly, moving our player data has risk. Downtime kills games, so we’re being cautious.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Totally get that. That’s why I’m reaching out—MongoDB Atlas was built to minimize migration risk, and we have tools to ensure low downtime and phased cutovers. Have you looked into managed Atlas yet?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: We’ve heard of it, but honestly, control and security are huge concerns for us.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely. Atlas actually offers more security than most on-prem setups. We’re talking automated patching, dedicated clusters, SOC 2, ISO 27001, and, uh, full encryption at rest and in transit. Can you share what specific compliance you need to hit?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: We’ve got to meet GDPR, plus, you know, some regional latency and failover requirements.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Atlas can help there, too. You can deploy clusters across 90+ regions and set up automatic failover—so if one region goes down, your game stays online. Is your current on-prem setup multi-region?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Not really, it’s—well, it’s pretty manual. But, to be honest, I worry about vendor lock-in and, uh, cost spikes.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Fair points. Actually, with Atlas, pricing is transparent, and you only pay for what you use. Plus, you can export your data at any time—no lock-in. Most teams actually save on ops cost.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: I mean, it sounds good, but we’d want to see a realistic migration plan for our scale. Otherwise, it’s a hard sell to leadership.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: For sure. Why don’t we schedule a quick call with our solution architect? We can walk you through a tailored migration roadmap, show live demos, and answer anything leadership throws at you.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Alright, can you send me some times? I’ll loop in our lead engineer too.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Absolutely, Zhi. I’ll follow up right after this call with a few slots. Appreciate your time—talk soon!
